params.text:
Walking the archive of District Six
By: David A. Wallace and Siddique Motala
Description: Using digital humanities to counter black erasure in South Africa. District Six is virtually reconstructed, using GIS combined with archival research (baptismal records) and interactions with ex-residents. Wallance and Motala created the decolonizing methodology Counter-Surveying where ex-residents walk the current District Six environment, and through surveying and other geographic tools, find the exact coordinates of former homes and landmarks and mark these with flags.

Data Feminism
By: Catherine D'Ignazio and Lauren Klein
Description: Seven feminist principles by D'Ignazio and Klein and how they can be applied in data science

Ni Una Menos Feminicide Map
By: Maria Salguero
Description: A visualisation of feminicide in Mexico, as a response to the government refused to collect data on it. Digital humanities becomes a form of research-activism and using counterdata to challenge power.

Queerlit Database
By: Jenny Bergenmar
Description: Queer Literature Database in Sweden that makes use of keywords developed by the target populations and encourages research into queer literature. Digital humanities helps encourage research and preservation of queer literature, one that is inclusive of queer populations too.

backgroundImageAltText: Examples of Social Justice in the Digital Humanities
